passage_text: Push chunks of white bread through the shredding disk of the food processor to make coarse crumbs. 1. Spread the crumbs on a baking sheet and bake at 300 degrees until the crumbs are dry BUT NOT TOASTED, about 6 to 8 minutes. Shake the crumbs at least 2 times during the cooking process. Be careful not to let them brown !! 2. Immediately remove bread crumbs from oven and allow then to cool

Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. Place all of the ingredients into a blender carafe, cover and pulse until coarse crumbs form, about 2 minutes. Spread the crumbs evenly on 2 half sheet pans and bake until the crumbs just begin to brown and are crisp, about 5 minutes. Cool the crumbs on the pans for 15 to 20 minutes, and then transfer to an airtight container and store at room temperature for up to 2 weeks. Recipe courtesy of Alton Brown, 2011.

Directions. 1  Push chunks of white bread through the shredding disk of a food processor to make coarse crumbs. 2  Spread the crumbs on a baking sheet and bake at 300 F degrees until the crumbs are dry but not toasted, about 6 to 8 minutes. 3  Shake the sheet twice during baking. 1 Spread the crumbs on a baking sheet and bake at 300 F degrees until the crumbs are dry but not toasted, about 6 to 8 minutes. 2  Shake the sheet twice during baking. 3  Be careful not to let the crumbs brown!

1 Push torn pieces of bread through the shredding disk of a food processor to make coarse crumbs. 2  Spread the crumbs on a baking sheet. 3  Bake in preheated oven until crumbs are dry but not toasted, 6 to 8 minutes. 1 Bake in preheated oven until crumbs are dry but not toasted, 6 to 8 minutes. 2  Shake the sheet twice during baking in order to evenly dry crumbs. 3  Remove from the oven and cool completely.
